citeinfo.origin: Adapted from U.S. Soil Conservation Service
citeinfo.title: Major Land Resource Areas (MLRA)

descript.abstract:
This is a polygon coverage of the Land Resource Regions and Major Land Resource Areas of the conterminous United States. Land resource regions are geographic areas that are characterized by a particular pattern of soils, climate, water resources and land uses. (USDA, Soil Conservation Service, 1981). Major land resource areas are subregions of the land resource regions and comprise smaller homogeneous areas. The scale of this coverage is 1:2,000,000.
Note: The Soil Conservation Service now (1995) is called the Natural Resources Conservation Service.
Descriptors:
Land Resource Regions Major Land Resource Areas United States
descript.purpose: The primary use of this coverage is for regional and national display rather than specific local data analysis due to the small scale (1:2,000,000) of this coverage.
descript.supplinf:
Procedures_Used:
This coverage was obtained from EROS Data Center U.S. Geological Survey National Mapping Division, Sioux Falls, SD. Eros Data Center received the digital data files from U.S. Soil Conservation Service, where it was automated from a 1:2,000,000 scale map. A copy of this map, ("Land Resource Regions and Major Land Resource Areas of the United States") is furnished with Agriculture Handbook 296, and is published at a scale of 1:7,500,000. It was first published in 1981, with information current as of 1978. The map was further revised as of January 1, 1984, and is the basis for the digital version of the map. (Bliss, 1989)
The map was compiled and digitized at a scale of 1:2,000,000 in the Albers Equal-Area Projection having the following parameters:
First parallel: 29 30 00 N Second parallel: 45 30 00 N Central meridian -96 00 00 W Latitude of projection origin: 23 00 00 N False easting: 0.0 False northing: 0.0
Revisions:
1.1 12/91 Enhanced the polygon attribute table. It now includes names of Land Resource Regions and Major Land Resource Areas.
Reviews_Applied_to_Data:
Has not been reviewed.
Related_Spatial_and_Tabular_Data_Sets:
At this time, there are no related data sets.
Other_References_Cited:
Bliss, Norman B. 1989. A National Natural Resource Data Base: Techniques for Linking the Major Land Resource Area map, the 1982 National Resources Inventory and the Soils Interpretations Record Data Bases in a Geographic Information System. Eros Data Center, Sioux Falls, SD.
U.S. Department of Agriculture Soil Conservation Service.1981. Land Resource Regions and Major Land Resource Areas of the United States. Agriculture Handbook 296. Washington, D.C

idinfo.useconst: Accuracy is good at 1:2,000,000 or smaller.

qattracc.attracce: Attribute accuracy is described, where present, with each attribute defined in the Entity and Attribute Section.

attr.attrdef: Area of polygon in square coverage units
Perimeter of polygon in coverage units

edom.edomv: Positive whole numbers, some followed by an alpha

attr.attrdef: Name of Major Land Resource Area

overview.eaover:
There are four attributes in the PAT file: LRR_CODE, MLRA_CODE, LRR and MLRA.
LRR_CODE contains the Land Resource Region Code. They are designated by a capital letter, and identified by a descriptive name, found in LRR.
MLRA_CODE contains the Major Land Resource Area code. It consists of a numerical value, some followed by a letter. The descriptive name is stored in MLRA.
The majority of the MLRA classifications can be found in Agriculture Handbook 296. There are, however, three categories that were added by EROS Data Center during automation. These classes are listed below:
MLRA_CODE MLRA
10A BIG AND LITTLE WOOD RIVER FOOT SLOPES 11A CENTRAL SNAKE RIVER PLAINS 11B UPPER SNAKE RIVER PLAINS
Refer to the 'notes' section for a complete listing of the various land resource region/major land resource area classifications.

distinfo.distliab:

The act of distribution shall not constitute any such warranty, and no responsibility is assumed by the U.S. Geological Survey in the use of this data, software, or related materials.
Any use of trade, product, or firm names is for descriptive purposes only and does not imply endorsement by the U.S. Government.

stdorder.fees: None. This dataset is provided by USGS as a public service.
